metadata.title: CVE-2019-2876 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox component of OracleVirtualization (subcomponent: Core). Supported versions that are affectedare Prior to 5.2.32 and prior to 6.0.10. Easily exploitable vulnerabilityallows low privileged attacker with logon to the infrastructure whereOracle VM VirtualBox executes to compromise Oracle VM VirtualBox.Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized abilityto cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) of Oracle VM VirtualBox.CVSS 3.0 Base Score 3.3 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2876` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-dkms - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-guest-utils - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-qt - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-source - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.18-dfsg-5').
